titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records, 1895-2012 UA.6.5.1
titlestmt.author: Emily Schoenlein.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:52:55 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records
did.abstract: The University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association's mission is to advance the University and enrich students and alumni worldwide. Begun as a social organization, the association now offers programs for alumni and encourages them to contribute their time, talent, and resources for the benefit of the University and other alumni. This collection documents these activities as well as the day-to-day operations of the Association.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records, 1895-2012, UA.6.5.1, University Archives, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association Records, 1895-2012, UA.6.5.1, University Archives, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection consists of eleven series:
Series II. Alumni Council and Board of Trustees, 1869-2007

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Material in the following boxes are restricted: Scholarships Box 6, Nominations Committee Box 17 Folder 13 through Box 19 Folder 18.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Alumni Association of the University of Pittsburgh Records document the activities of the Association as it works to serve the University and provide social events for alumni. Much of the material concerns the Association's day-to-day operations through the documentation of normal business activities, such as memoranda, correspondence, meeting minutes, agenda and packets for meetings, presentations, talking points, conference materials, election and nomination materials, and materials related to the Council of Alumni Association Executives and the Council for Advancement and Support of Education (CASE). The earliest records include meeting minutes (1908-1914), an undated grade report, alumni yearbooks, commencement programs, and a piece of correspondence regarding the Alumni Banquet of 1899. The most recent records consist of copies of the Association newsletter, the "Alumni Connection", from 2012.

Together these records consist of meeting minutes, by-laws, constitutions, magazines, newsletters, memoranda, correspondence including to and from the Chancellor, presentations, talking points, architectural drawings and design plans of the Alumni offices in Alumni Hall, strategic plans, quarterly planning documents, fundraising documents, event planning documents, conference materials, surveys, mailings sent to members and membership mailing lists, goals and objectives, board meeting packets, personnel files, resumes, advocacy records, sheet music, cartoons, and published journals of CASE.
The collection is rich in information pertaining to the policy decisions of the Association throughout its history, its relationships with its constituency groups and the University.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The Alumni Association of the Western University of Pennsylvania was formed on June 27, 1866, when a group of alumni agreed to meet for dinner once a year. The earliest known constitution and by-laws were accepted on June 29, 1892. The organization adopted the name General Alumni Association in February 1897. A new constitution and by-laws were adopted when the Western University of Pennsylvania became the University of Pittsburgh in 1908. The constitution and by-laws were once again adapted when the organization changed its name to the University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association on April 6, 1988.

The University of Pittsburgh Alumni Association's mission is to offer programs for alumni and encourage them to contribute their time, talent, and resources for the benefit of the University and other alumni, and to serve as advocates for the University within the Pittsburgh community, in the commonwealth of Pennsylvania, and throughout the world. The Alumni Association of the University of Pittsburgh Records document the activities of the Association as it works to serve the University and provide social and educational events for alumni. Much of the material concerns the association's day-to-day operations through the documentation of normal business activities, such as memoranda, correspondence, meeting minutes, agenda and packets for meetings, presentations, talking points, conference materials, election and nomination materials, and materials related to the Council of Alumni Association Executives and the Council for Advancement and Support of Education.

The earliest records include meeting minutes (1908-1914), an undated grade report, alumni yearbooks, commencement programs, and a piece of correspondence regarding the Alumni Banquet of 1899. The collection is rich in information pertaining to the policy decisions of the association throughout its history, its relationships with its constituency groups and the University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Emily Schoenlein in May-November 2014. Preliminary appraisal and organization of the collection was done by Sarah Hayes and Anne Morgans between 2010 and 2013.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records in this series detail the general operations of the office and staff of the Alumni Association as they perform their duties to lead the organization. It includes items regarding personnel (including former Executive Director Leland Patouillet) and membership, board meetings and meetings with individuals, strategic planning, scholarships, and the Alumni Legislative Network.

Alumni Council and Board of Trustees

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The records in this series relate to the governing documents of the Alumni Association and the decisions made by the Alumni Council and the Board of Trustees. It contains governing documents, records of Alumni Council, meeting minutes from the Board of Directors and Board of Trustees, minutes from the Executive Board, board retreat information, and records of the Nominations Committee and the Institutional Advancement Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records pertaining to the finances of the Alumni Association. It includes information on fundraising and the Association's financial reports, such as business expenses, budgets, and financial records.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series details records pertaining to the various groups associated with the Alumni Association. This includes a variety of outside groups and companies and the Crohn's & Colitis Foundation of America, as well as University of Pittsburgh groups, such as the African American Alumni Council, the Alumnae Council, the Pitt Alumni Recruitment Team, and other university constituent groups.

Pitt Stock of the Month Club

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records relating to how alumni can stay in touch or be contacted. This includes the Alumni Online Community and Alumni Directory initiatives, as well as several copies of the Alumni Directory.

did.unittitle: Alumni Directory- Guide to Data Exchange
Alumni Directory- How to Prepare Editorial Section
Alumni Directory- Editorial Section Original Materials

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series documents the events and activities sponsored by or attended by members of the Alumni Association. The Alumni Association has held events related to Homecoming and basketball and football games, as well as hosting dinners and receptions and presenting awards. They have also held lecture series and similar events such as University on the Road and the Chancellor's Tour in order to promote the university. Events such as Pittnics, Pitt Day, Discovery Weekend, and the Summer Discovery Showcase have all helped to promote the university as well. Constituent groups like the African American Alumni Council have held their own events, and there have been memorial events and a variety of other events for Alumni Association members.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records related to the various programs and projects initiated by the Alumni Association. The main subseries relate to the Banner Program, campaigns, and the plans regarding the conversion of the Masonic Temple into Alumni Hall. There are also records related to the issues surrounding the demolition of Pitt Stadium.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records of the several professional organizations of which the Alumni Association is a member. Former Executive Director Lee Patouillet was an active member of these groups, so these records reflect primarily his participation and interests.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains copies of the various publications produced by the Alumni Association. Included is the early Alumni Review, the published annual report of the organization, the Pitt Advocate Newsletter, the Alumni Connections Newsletter, and other miscellaneous publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains some of the earlist records of the Alumni Association. Most of the records are from the late nineteenth and early twentieth centuries, with the newest material dating to 1952.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains records that do not pertain to any other series in the collection. They detail important aspects of the Alumni Association, but they do not fit with any defined series and are therefore kept together and arranged chronologically.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio-visual material related to the Alumni Association. It is primarily VHS tapes but it also contains slides, CD-ROMS, DVDs, and digital camera memory cards.
